trans-unit.source: Provides compatibility with the Visual Basic 6.0 `ADO Data Control`, which enabled you to create a connection to a database using Microsoft ActiveX Data Objects (`ADO`).
Use this control in applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0 to continue to use an `ADO` data connection.
For new development, you should consider using `ADO.NET` instead of `ADO`.
For more information, see [Comparison of ADO.NET and ADO](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/98f2c0cd-437d-4934-8be5-c174b6782cae).

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC"></xref> class.
Provides compatibility with the Visual Basic 6.0 `ADO Data Control`.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Adds an interface to monitor changes in a data set.
The `DataSourceListener` monitors a data set for data members that are added, removed, or changed when the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC> is connected to a data source.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
A `Msdatasrc.DataSourceListener`.
Gets or sets the background color for a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC"></xref>.
Setting the `BackColor` property affects only the part of the control where text is displayed.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that represents the background color of the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC"></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the current row position is before the first row in a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset"></xref>.
The `BOF` and <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.EOF%2A> return values are determined by the location of the current row pointer if this pointer is valid.

If either `BOF` or <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.EOF%2A> is `true`, there is no current row, and any attempt to reference <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset%2A> data causes an exception.

You can use the `BOF` and <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.EOF%2A> properties to determine whether an <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset%2A> object contains rows or whether you have gone beyond the limits of an <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset%2A> as you move from row to row.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
`true` if the current row position is before the first row; otherwise `false`.

Gets or sets a value that indicates what action the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC"></xref> takes when the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.BOF"></xref> property is `true`.
Use this property to specify the behavior when the `MovePrevious` button is pressed and the first row of a <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset%2A> is the current row.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
A <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.BOFActionEnum"></xref> enumeration that specifies the action to take.
Gets or sets the number of records that are cached in local memory for the current <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset"></xref>.
The `CacheSize` value tells the provider how many records to keep in its buffer and how many records to fetch at one time to local memory.
For example, when set to 10, after opening the first <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset%2A>, the provider fetches the first 10 records into local memory.
Therefore, as you move forward from the current record, the provider returns the data values from the local memory buffer.
As soon as you move past the last record, the next 10 records are fetched from the data source into the cache.
While you can change value during the life of the cursor, the change only affects the number of records in the cache after the next fetch from the data source.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
An `Integer` that specifies the number of records that are cached in local memory for the current <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset"></xref> object.
The default is 50 records.
Gets or sets the duration, in seconds, that the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC"></xref> waits for a command to return from the server.
After this period of time has elapsed without completing the command, the provider raises an exception to the calling application and cancels the command.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
An `Integer` that specifies the number of seconds to wait when a connection is being established.
The default is 15 seconds.

Gets or sets a value that informs the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC"></xref> what type of command to pass when opening a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset"></xref>.
Setting this property optimizes the execution of the command.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
A `ADODB.CommandTypeEnum` enumeration that specifies the command type.
Gets of sets the information that is used to establish a connection to a data source.
Use the `ConnectionString` property to specify a data source by passing a detailed connection string that contains a series of argument = value statements separated by semicolons.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the connection information.

Gets or sets the duration of time, in seconds, for which the provider attempts to connect to the server specified in the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.ConnectionString"></xref> property.
This property corresponds to the ADO `ConnectionTimeout` property.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
An `Integer` that specifies the number of seconds to wait when a connection is being established.
The default is 15 seconds.
Gets or sets the location of the cursor library for the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC"></xref> object.
This property corresponds to the ADO Command and Connection `CursorLocation` property.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
A `ADODB.CursorLocationEnum` enumeration that specifies s the location.
The default is `ADODB.CursorLocationEnum.adUseClient`.
Gets or sets a value that specifies the default type of cursor to use when opening a result set from the specified query.
Determines the cursor type to use when opening a <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset%2A>.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
A `ADODB.CursorTypeEnum` enumeration that specifies the type of cursor to use.
Releases the unmanaged resources used by a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC"></xref> and optionally releases the managed resources.
This method is called by the public `Dispose()` method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method.
`Dispose()` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the disposing parameter set to `true`.
<xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with the disposing parameter set to `false`.
When the disposing parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this control references.
This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
`true` to release both managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
The `EndOfRecordset` event is called when there is an attempt to move to a row past the end of the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset"></xref>.
An `EndOfRecordset` event may occur if the `MoveNext` operation fails.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Gets a value that indicates whether the current row position is after the last row in a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset"></xref>.
The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.BOF%2A> and `EOF` return values are determined by the location of the current row pointer if this pointer is valid.

If either <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.BOF%2A> or `EOF` is `true`, there is no current row, and any attempt to reference <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset%2A> data causes an exception.

You can use the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.BOF%2A> and `EOF` properties to determine whether an <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset%2A> object contains rows or whether you have gone beyond the limits of an <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset%2A> as you move from row to row.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
`true` if the current row position is after the last row; otherwise `false`.

Gets or sets a value that indicates what action the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC"></xref> takes when the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.EOF"></xref> property is `true`.
Use this property to specify the behavior when the `MoveNext` button is pressed when the first row of a <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset%2A> is the current row.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
A <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.EOFActionEnum"></xref> enumeration that specifies the action to take.
Occurs when an exception is raised in a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC"></xref>.
Use this event to handle exceptions that derive from the underlying OLE DB `DataSource`.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Occurs when a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC"></xref> control completes a fetch from a database.
For more information about how to handle events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Occurs while a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC"></xref> control is fetching data from a database.
For more information about how to handle events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Occurs when an update to a `Field` in a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset"></xref> for a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC"></xref> control is complete.
For more information about how to handle events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Returns a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset"></xref> for a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC"></xref>.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that describes the data member that represents one or more sets of data supported by the data source.
The interface identifier of the specified data access object.
Returns a data access object (such as a row position) for a given data member.
Implements the OLE DB `DataSource.getDataMemberCount` method.
Used internally to return a count of data members for the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC>.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
An `Integer` that represents the count.
Implements the OLE DB `DataSource.getDataMemberName` method.
Used internally to return the name of a data member for a <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC>.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
An index into the list of data member names.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that describes the data member name.
Gets or sets a value that indicates the type of concurrency handling.

In order to maintain sufficient control over the data being updated, `ADO` provides a number of concurrency options that control how other users are granted, or refused access to the data being updated.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
A `ADODB.LockTypeEnum` enumeration that specifies the type of concurrency handling.
Gets or sets the maximum number of records that can be retrieved from the data source.
This property corresponds to the ADO `Recordset.MaxRecords` property.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
An `Integer` that specifies the number of records that can be retrieved from the data source.
Gets or sets a value that specifies the available permissions for modifying data in a `Connection` or opening a `Record` in a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC"></xref>.
This property corresponds to the ADO `Mode` property.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
A `ADO.ConnectModeEnum` that specifies the mode.
Occurs when a `MoveFirst`, `MoveNext`, or `MoveLast` method has occurred in a `Recordset` for a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC"></xref> control.
For more information about how to handle events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.Resize"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
The `OnResize` method also enables derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC"></xref> will be oriented horizontally (the default) or vertically.
This property corresponds to the ADO `Recordset.MaxRecords` property.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
A <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.OrientationEnum"></xref> enumeration that specifies the orientation.
Sets the password that is used during the creation of an ADO `Recordset` object.
This property setting is write-only.
It may only be provided in code, it cannot be read back from the `Password` property.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the password.
Occurs when the current record has changed in the `Recordset` of a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC"></xref> control.
For more information about how to handle events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Gets or sets a reference to the underlying ADO `Recordset` object.
By using the `Recordset` property, you can use the methods, properties, and events of the ADO `ADODB.Recordset` Object.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
An ADO `Recordset` object.
Occurs when the `Recordset` for a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC"></xref> control changes.
For more information about how to handle events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Gets or sets the statement or query that returns a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Recordset"></xref>.
The `RecordSource` contains both the name of a database table and a valid SQL string using syntax appropriate for the data source.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the statement or query.
Forces a control to invalidate its client area and immediately redraw itself and any child controls.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Removes a `DataSourceListener`.
The `DataSourceListener` monitors a data set for data members that are added, removed, or changed when the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC> is connected to a data source.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].

They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
A `Msdatasrc.DataSourceListener`.
Gets or sets the text that is contained in the display area of a <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC"></xref>.
Use this property to communicate information such as the number of the current record to the user.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].

A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that specifies the text.
Gets or sets a value that represents a user of an ADO `Recordset` object.
The user-name syntax depends on the data source.

When a `UserName` and <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.Password%2A> are supplied, the control uses the values to create a connection string (<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC.ConnectionString%2A> property).

A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains a user name.
